intro: Triopterys discolor var. andina, commonly known as the Andean triopterys, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive discoloration pattern. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments at higher elevations. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, often clustered in umbels. It is valued for its ornamental foliage and is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
